testCases.explanation: Jump from index 0 to index 1 (jump 1), then from index 1 to index 4 (jump 3). 2 jumps total.
Jump from index 0 to index 1, then to index 4. 2 jumps total.
Jump from index 0 to index 1 (jump 1), then from index 1 to index 2 (jump 2). 2 jumps.
Already at the last index; 0 jumps needed
Must jump one step at a time; 3 jumps needed to reach index 3

description: Given an array of non-negative integers nums where you are at index 0, return the minimum number of jumps to reach the last index. You can jump at most nums[i] steps forward from index i. It is guaranteed you can reach the last index.

examples.explanation: The minimum number of jumps to reach the last index is 2. Jump 1 step from index 0 to 1, then 3 steps to the last index.

constraints: It is guaranteed that you can reach nums[n-1]
